courses.title: Introduction to Pentesting and Ethical Hacking with Kali Linux
courses.desc: This course introduces ethical hackers and penetration testers to Kali Linux. It will show IT professionals how to use the ethical hacking techniques and how to conduct a professional penetration test workflow using the Skid Army Knife operating system Kali Linux.

courses.title: Hack Yourself First; How to go on the Cyber-Offense
courses.desc: Hack Yourself First is all about developers building up cyber-offense skills and proactively seeking out security vulnerabilities in their own websites before an attacker does.

courses.title: OWASP Top 10
courses.desc: OWASP Top 10 The Big Picture is all about understanding the top 10 web security risks we face on the web today in an easily consumable, well-structured fashion that aligns to the number one industry standard on the topic today.

courses.title: Reconnaissance/Footprinting
courses.desc: This is the initial stage in gaining a blueprint of the security profile of a target, and it is accomplished in an organized manner. Reconnaissance is one of the three pre-attack phases, and results in a unique profile of an organization's networks and systems.

courses.title: SQL Injection
courses.desc: This course takes you through everything from understanding the SQL syntax used by attackers, basic injection attacks, database discovery and data exfiltration, advanced concepts, and even using injection for network reconnaissance and running system commands.

courses.title: Scanning Networks
courses.desc: It's time to learn how to dig around what you've found for important, relevant data in preparation for your attacks

courses.title: Enumeration
courses.desc: Enumeration is the first official attack at your target. Enumeration is the process of gathering information that might include user names, computer names, network shares, services running, and other possible points of entry.

courses.title: Hacking Web Servers
courses.desc: In this course, we'll look at various attack vectors in web servers. These include exploiting misconfigured servers, leveraging weaknesses in unpatched environments, compromising weak SSL implementations and much, much more.

courses.title: Hacking Web Applications
courses.desc: In this course, we'll look a range of different security paradigms within web applications both conceptually and in practice. They'll be broken down into detail, exploited, and then discussed in the context of how the attacks could have been prevented.

courses.title: Cryptography
courses.desc: In this course, you will learn to understand and apply fundamental concepts of cryptography, the learner will understand requirements for cryptography, understand and support secure protocols, and will gain an understanding of how to operate and implement cryptographic systems.

courses.title: Sniffing
courses.desc: You need to keep your network protected from attackers. This course will help you to understand how network sniffing works and how to keep your information secure.

courses.title: Session Hijacking
courses.desc: Session persistence is a fundamental concept in information systems. On the web, for example, which is dependent on the stateless HTTP protocol, session persistence is a key component of features ranging from shopping carts to the ability to logon.

courses.title: Social Engineering
courses.desc: In this course, we'll look at various different social engineering techniques that can be used to compromise systems. We'll also look at both computer-based and behavior-based tools to help defend against this risk.

courses.title: System Hacking
courses.desc: After we've done our research, we've found our target, and identified its services, shares, users and resources, it's time to take total and complete control of this box.

courses.title: Denial of Service
courses.desc: In this course, you'll explore various ways DoS attacks are constructed and the weaknesses they exploit in order to be successful. You'll also delve into defensive patterns to help protect services from malicious attacks

courses.title: Hacking Wireless Networks
courses.desc: In this course, you'll learn the hacking methods that can be used to gain access to your network and how to best lower that security risk.

courses.title: Malware Threats
courses.desc: This course will take you deep into the dark alley of how malware is used and deployed. We'll also dive into how Trojans and backdoors work. We'll look at what their purpose is, the signs that you have one, and how attackers cleverly hide them.

courses.title: Evading IDS, Firewalls, and Honeypots
courses.desc: This course looks at how security defenses such as intrusion detection systems, firewalls, and honeypots are intended to work and how attackers typically circumvent them.

courses.title: Hacking Mobile Platforms
courses.desc: Most folks have approached mobile devices with the attitude of if it works, syncs, and plays games, I'm good. Overlooking this side of technology will lead you into one day appearing on an online video with the words FAIL plastered across your face.

courses.title: Introduction to Firewalls
courses.desc: If you know the basics of networking but have been mystified by firewalls, this course is for you. This course will give you the detailed fundamentals of how a stateful firewall operates and how it functions in a network.

courses.title: Introduction to browser security headers
courses.desc: Browser security headers provide a means for websites to describe how they should behave when loaded into the client. By specifying expected and allowable behaviors, security headers can thwart a number of otherwise serious attacks against websites.

courses.title: Introduction to Wireshark
courses.desc: In this course, we will walk through the basics of Wireshark. Because Wireshark only captures what it sees on the network, we will also describe common protocols, and examine their operation using Wireshark captures.

courses.title: Troubleshooting with Wireshark
courses.desc: Improve your network behavior troubleshooting skills and knowledge of protocols with this course. Youll use Wireshark to observe protocol logic, examine ICMP messages, capture DHCP traffic, and learn about basic DNS operation and how TCP operates.

courses.title: All about buffer overflows
courses.desc: This course breaks down the technical subjects of computer memory management, controlling code, and data inside of a running program, and exploiting poor quality software into terms that IT people with no software development experience can understand.

courses.title: Network Pentesting using Python and Kali linux
courses.desc: This course introduces how to move from novice scripting to professional penetration testing, by using the cross-platform programming language, Python.

courses.title: Metasploit Basics
courses.desc: Using Metasploit and some associated tools, you will be able to simulate attacks whether from inside or external to the network.

courses.title: CloudFlare Security
courses.desc: In this course, well look at CloudFlare's free service

courses.title: Hack your API first
courses.desc: Recent years have seen a massive explosion in the growth of rich client apps that talk over the web using APIs across HTTP, but unfortunately, all too often they contain serious security vulnerabilities that are actually very easy to locate.

courses.title: SSCP: Risk Identification, Monitoring, and Analysis
courses.desc: In this course, you will learn to understand the risk management process, perform security assessment activities, operate and maintain monitoring systems, and analyze monitoring results.

courses.title: Check Point Certified Security Administrator; Install & Deploy
courses.desc: The Check Point Security Administration Course will prepare network engineers to deploy the network security solution trusted by 100% of all Fortune 100 companies worldwide

courses.title: Software Security
courses.desc: Course from coursera which talks about all sorts of software security risks, ranging from XSS to code injection, NOP sleds, etc

courses.title: Hardware Security
courses.desc: Course from coursera, talks about the hardware attack vectors

courses.title: Bitcoin & Cryptocurrency tech, by anominous - thanks!
courses.desc: Bitcoin & Cryptocurrency tech

courses.title: C++ Fundamentals
courses.desc: In this course, I'll cover basics of language syntax; declaring variables, classes, building expressions using operators and functions; and work up to templates, pointers, const, and polymorphism.

courses.title: C++ Advanced topics
courses.desc: In this course you'll draw on your C++ Fundamentals knowledge to explore a number of ways to ensure your applications are implemented in Modern C++, not C-With-Classes or other old-style idioms. You'll take advantage of the Standard Library and write code that is future proof and safe.

courses.title: Javascript from Scratch
courses.desc: In this course, you will learn all you need to know to get started programming with this powerful language that can be used for creating web applications or Windows 8 applications. This course assumes no prior programming experience.

courses.title: Introduction to Javascript, by anominous - thanks dude, you rock!
courses.desc: In this course, you will learn all you need to know to get started programming with this powerful language that can be used for creating web applications or Windows 8 applications. This course assumes no prior programming experience.

courses.title: Introduction to HTML (for designers - you don't really need to be a designer)
courses.desc: By the time this course is over you'll have the knowledge you need to start writing your own HTML from scratch

courses.title: Introduction to JQuery (for designers - you don't really need to be a designer)
courses.desc: This course will cover presentational uses of jQuery such as selecting elements, manipulating and traversing the DOM, basic and custom jQuery animation, event handling.

courses.title: Introduction to CSS (for designers - you don't really need to be a designer)
courses.desc: In this tutorial we'll learn how to use CSS to style a resort website from scratch.

courses.title: Get started with AngularJS
courses.desc: This course demonstrates how to use the essential abstractions of AngularJS, including modules, controllers, directives, and services.

courses.title: Building Angular and Node JS Apps with the MEAN Stack
courses.desc: Learn to build an end to end application with Angular, Node, Express and Mongo

courses.title: ExtJS Desktop Fundamentals
courses.desc: In this course you will learn the basics of building an ExtJS web application.

courses.title: Python Fundamentals
courses.desc: Python Fundamentals gets you started with Python, a dynamic language popular for web development, big data, science, and scripting.

courses.title: Python Beyond the basics
courses.desc: Python - Beyond the Basics deepens and broadens your knowledge of Python, a dynamic language popular for web development, big data, science, and scripting.

courses.title: Ruby 2.0, by anominous - thanks dude!
courses.desc: Basics of Ruby 2.0

courses.title: Getting started with BackBone.js, by anominous - thanks dude
courses.desc: Backbone.js is a set of tools that gives structure to client-side web applications. It helps us write clean, maintainable JavaScript applications.

courses.title: Introduction to Network Security
courses.desc: Part 1 of 3 in the Cisco CCNA Security (640-554) series will teach you how to identify, lockdown, and secure vulnerabilities in a small to medium enterprise branch network.

courses.title: AAA and IP Security
courses.desc: Part 2 of 3 in the Cisco CCNA Security (640-554) series. This course will teach you how to identify, lockdown, and secure vulnerabilities in a small to medium enterprise branch network.

courses.title: Firewalls and VPNs
courses.desc: Part 3 of 3 in the Cisco CCNA Security (640-554) series will teach you how to identify, lockdown, and secure vulnerabilities in a small to medium enterprise branch network.

courses.title: CompTIA A+ Part 1: Computer Hardware
courses.desc: In this course, we perform a comprehensive survey of all interior and external personal computer (PC) hardware. The subject matter maps to every objective in the Hardware domain of the CompTIA A+ 220-901 certification exam.

courses.title: CompTIA A+ Part 2: Networking
courses.desc: This course covers every Windows Operating Systems domain objective in the CompTIA A+ 220-902 exam blueprint.

courses.title: CompTIA A+ Part 3: Peripherals and best practices
courses.desc: In this course, we perform a comprehensive survey of all interior and external personal computer (PC) hardware. The subject matter maps to every objective in the Hardware domain of the CompTIA A+ 220-901 certification exam.

courses.title: CompTIA A+ Part 4: Operating System
courses.desc: This course covers every Windows Operating Systems domain objective in the CompTIA A+ 220-902 exam blueprint.

courses.title: CompTIA A+ Part 5: Mobile Devices and Troubleshooting
courses.desc: This course covers every objective from the Mobile Devices domain of the CompTIA 220-901 certification exam.

courses.title: CompTIA Security+ Domain 1 - Network Security.
courses.desc: This course fully prepares you for the Networking domain of the CompTIA A+ 220-901 certification exam.

courses.title: Network Architecture
courses.desc: The student learns the basic building blocks of Ethernet networks and emerges with an excellent, well-rounded understanding of computer networking fundamentals.

courses.title: Network Operations
courses.desc: Network operations is really the magic that makes IT systems work. This course will walk the viewer through many of the primary technologies used to make surfing the web possible.

courses.title: Network Security
courses.desc: CompTIA Security+ (2014 Objectives) prepares networking and IT professionals with the knowledge and skills required to identify risk, to participate in risk mitigation activities, and to provide infrastructure, application, information, and operational security.

courses.title: Linux Installation and Initial Configuration
courses.desc: Learning to work with and master multiple Linux distributions. This is the 1st of 4 courses that will prepare you for the LPIC-1 and CompTIA Linux+ certification.

courses.title: Introduction to the Bash Shell
courses.desc: The command line is one of the most important tools for a Linux/UNIX power user. Bash is the default login shell on Linux and Mac OS, and adding it to your skillset will open up a whole new world of possibilities.

courses.title: Shell Scripting with Bash
courses.desc: Bash shell scripts allow you to automate just about any task on a UNIX system. They combine the power of all the UNIX userland utilities with a powerful scripting language. Whether you are a system administrator, a developer or a power user, shell scripts will make you more productive.

courses.title: Linux Command Line Interface Fundamentals
courses.desc: Mastering the command line is so important when it comes to managing the Linux Server. Very often there will be no GUI and all access is via SSH from PuTTY or another client. You will soon learn the speed at which tasks can be achieved from the CLI and why it is so powerful.

courses.title: Adobe Premiere Pro CC Fundamentals
courses.desc: In this course, we'll review how to create new projects, import media, and build sequences in Adobe Premiere Pro CC.

courses.title: Animation and Video Editing in Photoshop CS6
courses.desc: We'll begin this course by learning about some of the basic features of the video portion of the timeline panel where we'll learn how to import video clips and do some basic editing.

courses.title: Color Correction and Grading in Adobe Premiere Pro and SpeedGrade
courses.desc: Throughout this tutorial, we will learn all about the plethora of color correcting and grading tools found within Adobe's video editing application, Premiere Pro.

courses.title: Action Scene Editing Techniques in Adobe Premiere Pro
courses.desc: Action Scene Editing Techniques in Adobe Premiere Pro -- http://www.mediafire.com/download/0gu7x007mpaclwd/Action+Scene+Editing+Techniques+in+Adobe+Premiere+Pro.rar

courses.title: Adobe Premiere Pro CS6 Setup [This is the software, not a course]
courses.desc: The software required for the video editing courses

courses.title: Clean Code
courses.desc: Anyone can write code a computer can understand, but professional developers write code *humans* can understand. Clean code is a reader-focused development style that produces software that's easy to write, read and maintain.

courses.title: Test Driven Development with Brad Wilson
courses.desc: Brad Wilson creates a subscription billing system under the gun - using TDD.

courses.title: The fundamentals of Scrum methodology
courses.desc: This course introduces the business case for Scrum, the core Scrum framework, and and the raw ingredients for bootstrapping Scrum in your organization.

courses.title: Building a successful blog
courses.desc: In this introductory course on blogging we will go over a few of the basics of blogging and show the way to get started with blogging immediately.

courses.title: Building a high traffic profitable blog
courses.desc: In this course, we discuss the essential elements to bringing quality content to the masses, making it popular, and monetizing your effort.

courses.title: Cloud security
courses.desc: In this course, you will be learning about the basics of cloud computing, security best practices for clouds, and other cloud security considerations that will ensure success for your business.

courses.title: Introduction to penetration testing using Metasploit
courses.desc: Metasploit is an essential tool in the penetration tester's arsenal. This course will teach you the foundations of using the Metasploit Framework to find and verify vulnerabilities in your systems.

courses.title: C Fundamentals
courses.desc: The C Programming Language course is designed to give you everything you need to become a productive C programmer.

courses.title: C in Action
courses.desc: This course will provide you with a complete and practical tour of the C programming language and libraries.

courses.title: Java Fundamentals
courses.desc: This course provides complete coverage of the Java programming language and serves as a strong foundation for all Java-based development environments including client-based, server-side, and Android.

courses.title: Fiddler
courses.desc: Learn how to use the popular Fiddler freeware web tracing tool.

courses.title: Cloud Computing
courses.desc: In this course, we'll look at the ways the cloud can enable us to build more secure software than ever, whilst also identifying where it can leave us more vulnerable. We'll also look at hardening the cloud

courses.title: Wireshark 2.0
courses.desc: This is a fundamental course that provides you with the knowledge that you need to use Wireshark 2.0 to capture packets on any network interface, and to display, navigate, and analyze this packet capture

courses.title: Introduction to Pentesting
courses.desc: In this course, you will learn the ins and outs of planning and executing a penetration test against your own or your clients network. This course is a 10,000 foot view of penetration testing

courses.title: Network Security Testing With NMAP
courses.desc: This course presents NMAP, a network scanning tool, from basic usage through advanced service analysis.

courses.title: Introduction to PowerShell
courses.desc: This is an introductory course on PowerShell and how to use it for basic IT Operations support.

courses.title: Introduction to Arduino
courses.desc: This course is an introduction to the Arduino hardware and software platform.

courses.title: Raspberry Pi Home Server
courses.desc: Turn a Raspberry Pi computer into a fully-featured home server. Run your home for a penny a day.

courses.title: Raspberry Pi for Developers
courses.desc: This course is an introduction to the Raspberry Pi platform.

courses.title: Django Fundamentals
courses.desc: This course teaches the basics of web development with the Django framework. It will teach you everything you need to become a productive Python web developer.

CHFI certifies individuals in the specific security discipline of computer forensics from a vendor-neutral perspective. The CHFI certification will fortify the application knowledge of law enforcement personnel, system administrators, security officers, defense and military personal, legal professionals, bankers, security professionals, and anyone who is concerned about the integrity of the network infrastructure.

commands.ask: Don't ask to ask, just ask!
commands.goldmine: Get your computer sk1llz improved with these amazing courses! -> download -> www.ghostbin.com/paste/wsyuc or www.github.com/caseanon/Dump || WATCH ONLINE http://handbookproject.github.io
commands.read: Read before asking! Most problems can be solved by reading the actual output you are getting from the program. Just go ahead and read them so you can be one step ahead to solving the problem.
commands.version: The bot is currently running on version 3. Code is open-sourced on https://github.com/caseanon/SexyTeacherBot. This bot was forked from ClaudiaMIND v0.1.3 - Special thanks to ClaudiaD and leet. https://github.com/ClaudiaDAnon/Hive
commands.linux: Linux?? Never heard of it. Oh, wait, you must mean GNU/Linux!
commands.browse: Before asking a question be sure you have checked out all your resources to try to fix it, most of the times, answers are just in Google
commands.donate: Case needs money for drugs. Also money to maintain and improve this channel. Ask him for a btc/eth address. You are welcome.

helps.goldmine: This command will print the goldmine with the full list of courses. Most of them are extracted from pluralsight, others are provided by anons.
helps.desc: This command will provide a description on a given course. Usage: ?desc <coursenumber>. Eg: ?desc 1 - Courses go from 0, 1, 2 and upwards. The course identifier can be found in the ?goldmine
helps.randomcourse: This command will print a random course from the goldmine, in case you want to do one and can't decide

whatof.luna: When I admire the beauty of Luna, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.
whatof.Case: Henry Dorsett Case is a low-level hustler in the underworld of Chiba City, Japan. Once a talented computer hacker, Case was caught stealing from his employer. As punishment, Case's nervous system was damaged with a mycotoxin, leaving him unable to access the global computer network in cyberspace. Unemployable, addicted to drugs, and suicidal, Case desperately searches the Chiba black clinics for a miracle cure.
